sailpoint.object

Class Policy

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.SailPointObject
        • sailpoint.object.Policy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Describable, PolicyViolation.IPolicyViolationOwnerSource, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject, sailpoint.tools.xml.XMLReferenceTarget

    public class Policy
extends SailPointObject
implements PolicyViolation.IPolicyViolationOwnerSource, Describable
    A class encapsulating the definition of a policy.

    There are several types of policy but the same model is used to simplify persistence. Some properties defined in this class are only used with certain policy types.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ARG_RISK_WEIGHT

        public static final java.lang.String ARG_RISK_WEIGHT
        The name of an optional policy attribute whose value is used by the PolicyScorer as the default risk weight for violations of this policy. This is used with custom policies that do not have GenericConstraints which is where weights usually live.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isTemplate

        public boolean isTemplate()
        True if this is a template policy. These will not be displayed in the policy table, but they are used to build the select list of policy types when creating new policies.

      • getConfigPage

        public java.lang.String getConfigPage()
        The URL fragment of a JSF page used to configure this policy. When set, this is expected to be a path to a JSF page relative to web/define/policy that will allow a user to configure a policy. If not set it defaults to genericpolicy.xhtml.

      • setConfigPage

        public void setConfigPage(java.lang.String url)

      • getCertificationActions

        public java.lang.String getCertificationActions()
        The allowed certification actions for violations of this policy. This is a CSV, if the value is null then all actions are allowed. The allowed actions are being encoded using CertificationStatus names, so the tense is technically wrong, if "Approved" is on this list, then you are allowed to take the "Approve" action on this violation.

      • setCertificationActions

        public void setCertificationActions(java.lang.String actions)

      • getExecutor

        public java.lang.String getExecutor()
        The fully qualified class name to the PolicyExecutor implementation.

      • getState

        public Policy.State getState()
        The state of the policy. There are currently only two states: Active and Inactive. A policy must be in the Active state for it to be processed.

      • setState

        public void setState(Policy.State s)

      • derive

        public Policy derive(Resolver r)
              throws GeneralException
        Derive a new policy from a template. This object is expected to be a template policy. It is cloned and some unnecessary fields are removed. NOTE: The template must have been fully loaded.
        Overrides:
        derive in class SailPointObject

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        We override equals so that two objects will compare equal if they have the same database id or unique name, but are different Java objects. This is necessary for Hibernate because caches commonly have to be cleared or objects from one session need to be used to match things loaded in a different session.
        Overrides:
        equals in class SailPointObject
